data.title: Great for kids!!
data.text: If you visit World of Wonders when they have their special events, the kids get to learn so much about science. It is definitely worth a visit.

data.title: KIDS!
data.text: This is a great place for kids and adults. Everything here is fascinating and instructional. My kids loved it and now my grand-kids love it.

data.title: 4 VERY happy toddlers
data.text: We were visiting the area and took our 2 year old here. There were more than a few squills of delight. I would say good for kids through 10.

data.title: Mini-Exploratorium
data.text: This space provides  hands-on science experiments for people of all ages.  My 11 year old nephew and I spent over two hours roaming the exhibits and continues to talk about them the rest of the afternoon.  I hear they host adults only events in the evenings that I would like to try.

data.title: Great kids venue.  Consider hosting a birthday party here!
data.text: This is a great place to get your kids excited about science.  It is a miniature Exploratorium with several displays which address any number of scientific phenomenon.  Very good venue for parent/child interaction because the kids will have many questions.  It is even interesting for the parents.  I only wish they had more space to space the number of displays.  We held one of our kids birthday parties there.  It was great.  The staff were very helpful.  They allowed you to choose an activity for the party.  We chose ice cream making.  Needless to say it was a big hit!

data.title: Very good place
data.text:
Went with family day after Halloween.  They were doing a pumpkin chuckin, family had a great time.The museum is very interactive and educational. 
I would recommend it for families children or anyone interested in science.

data.title: Small Museum
data.text: Excellent small museum for adults and children in Downtown Lodi.  My two grandchildren, ages 7 & 11 both enjoy this museum for the hands-on experiences. Too bad it's location is on the sleazy Sacramento Street in Lodi.

data.title: Fun for the kids
data.text: Great place for the kids to play and discover science. The only downfall was the volunteer in the Illumination area. She was not very friendly

data.title: Great Kids Experience
data.text: Our grandson completed the Lodi, CA library summer reading program, and in doing so, was awarded a free pass for a day at World of Wonders. It's the best place for kids (and adults) to go and explore science in a fun and safe environment.

data.title: Great hands on experience
data.text: If you have kids that are about 9 years old or younger, this is totally worth a great couple of hours of entertainment.  I went with my 15 year old daughter to meet up with my nephew and nieces (ages 5-9).  My nieces and nephew were quite entertained (& educated) looking at the different exhibits.  Many require the children to read about the science behind the "fun", but all of the kids joyfully interacted with the science rather than read the information.  The five year old twins loved the bubble solution, the 7 year old liked the catching her shadow and the 9 year old liked the kaleidoscope.  My 15 year old even found a few stations were she was entertained. The museum was clean and comfortable with a few chairs around the exhibits for the adults to sit and catch their breath while the kids discovered.  I saw several volunteers going around to clean/sanitize the exhibits to keep the interactive exhibits clean for everyone.Good value for the money and a great time was had by the kids.  Ample FREE parking near the museum was an added bonus!

data.title: Best place for families!
data.text: The WOW museum is the best place in Lodi for families. Great hands on science museum with a variety of exhibits! Appropriate for a wide range of ages. So many wonderful programs year round. Even science night live the first Wednesday of the month for adults- FREE! A must go to place! Once you go, you'll keep coming back! Go ahead and buy a membership.

data.title: Wonders galore!
data.text: Visionary Lodians led by Sally Snyde created an excellent kid-oriented attraction that draws hundreds of school children each year! Changing exhibits keep things interesting (and keep people coming back for more!).

data.title: WOW .. a fun place for young scientists!
data.text: We planned a family getaway to Lodi and joined this amazing hands on World of Wonders Science Museum.  We were there for over 2 hours!! So many experiments and friendly staff to teach and advise the children who had many questions! Very clean bathrooms!  You'll really enjoy this place, no pressure to leave at all!!

data.title: Family fun
data.text: My eight year old and my twelve year old always have a terrific-hands-on-time, here at WOW. The exhibits are very interactive. The small gift shop holds a great deal. The interior is very clean and it's centrally located if you desire to walk about afterwards to grab a meal.

data.title: Wow! If you've got young children, this place is teriffic!
data.text: Reasonable admission fees, friendly staff, wonderful exhibits, and free parking. The museum is packed with activities for both children & adults. Comfortable seating for grownups to sit and supervise their children. A delightful space is provided for toddler-sized activities. Clean restrooms. Within walking distance are ice cream, a movie theater, nice restaurants, all in the lovely Lodi downtown. Great brain teasing puzzles to challenge all ages.

data.title: Good day with the kids
data.text: When first getting there, I realized it was a lot smaller than I expected it to be, but for being so small, there is a lot to do and a lot for the kids to learn.  My kids wanted to do it all, but didn't give me much time to read to them why they were doing the things.  But it was a really good day, we stayed for almost 3 hours.  I can imagine how crowded it can be when school field trips are there.

data.title: A little bit too worn out.
data.text: This attraction seems a little worse for it's wear.  Many attractions are minimally operative.  It seem to be a place where mothers with young children can bring them to play.  The displays do help in explaining science to the observer, but some how lags as a true science museum.

data.title: Perfect afternoon with the elementary age set!
data.text: Although everyone in my family has enjoyed a visit to the World of Wonders Science Museum, my 5 year-old granddaughters always have a grand time--we have visited several times.  There are plenty of friendly staff on hand to help, new exhibits every time we go, and great free parking in the public garage behind the museum, and sometimes on the street.  The museum is small, but packed with activities in a completely open bright and clean space. There are comfortable seats for grownups to sit and supervise their children.  A delightful space is provided for toddler-sized activities.  Clean restrooms. The W.O.W. Museum is a great place to spend a couple of hours with your child or grandchild.  Also perfect for small groups, homeschool groups, and play groups.  Well worth the admission price.  Memberships are available.  Within a couple of blocks are ice cream, a movie theater, nice restaurants, all in the lovely Lodi downtown.

data.title: Fun stop with curious kids
data.text: This is a community funded and managed science museum and everything is hands on.   The volunteers are great with kids and there is literally something for every interest and no no-nos which is the best.  Cute gift shop with unique toys and experiments

data.title: Super Cool
data.text: This is a great Children's Museum with a focus on science and FUN learning.  It's awesome and super fun for adults, too!  What a gem for this City.  Don't miss it!
